turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I call the policia.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No police.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: But, Senor--

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No police!  Wait until I'm gone.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Senor, you need a doctor.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No police!

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Hey!  You there!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You want something, old man?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Don't call me old man.  Ain't you got no respect, boy?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You want something?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Yeah I want something.  I want you to run over to that machine and get me a pop.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You can't do that yourself?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Hell no, I can't do that myself.  I'm blind.  Can't you see that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm sorry, I didn't--

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: What'd you think I was doing out here with these glasses on?  Sunnin' myself?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't know.  I thought you were keeping the sun out of your eyes.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: I ain't got no eyes.  You want to see?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Christ no!

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Lost my eyes in Vyee-et-nam.  Lost them fighting the commies.  Fought the war and lost my eyes fightin' the commies just so you can come around here and make fun of me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I said I was sorry.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Don't be sorry.  Just run over there and get me my pop before I die of thirst.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, sure.  You got change?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Change?  You want my change?  I fought the war and lost my eyes just so I could give you my change?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: All right, old man.  Christ.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Don't forget to open it for me.  I can't be opening my own bottle.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Christ!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I think you'd better give your pooch a sip. He looks sick.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: That's 'cause he's dead.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: I hope you wasn't pettin' him none, was you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the hell are you keeping a dead dog around for?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: He's only just dead.  What was I supposed to do with him?  I can't take him away anywhere.  And nobody wants to take him for me.  Do you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hell no!

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: See.  Ain't nothing I can do but keep him here beside me.  That's where he belongs anyways.  Me and Jesse, that's my dog, not anymore, but me and Jesse we been pals since the war when I lost my eyes.  He was just a pup then... a companion that's loyal, that'll keep coming back to you no matter how much you kick him...I miss him.  I'll see ya later, unless I come across something worse.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You sure seen a lot for a blind man.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Just 'cause I ain't got eyes doesn't mean I can't see.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That a fact?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Maybe I do.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Or maybe you just think you do. Just another small town. One guy chasing you. You go big town. Just gonna have four guys after you instead. Kiss kissy kiss. It gets down to one thing -- are you a human being or are you one of those hungry ghosts out there never satisfied with nothing? Cause you gotta remember you can run just as far as you can, but wherever you go, that's where you gonna be.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I think I've heard that before.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: What do you want for free?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You sure got a lot of philosophy, old man.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Seems like I do but only cause end of the day we're all eyes in the same head. And everything is everything.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: ...And everything is nothing too.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Cocksucker motherfucker! Cops. I hear you. Always sneaking around. Thinks I can't see him. Well he's right. Motherfucker. But that ain't mean I don't know what's going on around here. They're all cursed. Yes sir.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Who's cursed?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: All them miners last century. Hungry ghosts, killed off all the Indians. Up at the mine. Earth ran red with blood, think I'm fooling around here. White sky was on fire. Grown men cried like babies. I saw a flash, then darkness descended upon me. They put me in the joint. Took my eyes. I cursed them. White people can't seem to stay away from Indians . You gotta watch where ya put your fingers. Pussy pussy pussy, Indian pussy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I thought you said you lost your eyes in the war?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: So now you're going to tell me where I lost my eyes. You don't think I know where I lost my eyes? I was there when I lost them. I lost them in the war. The war in the joint. There's always wars in the joint. Cause I was a code talker in the joint and in the war too. Mmmm, nothing like the smell of a naked lady. Be careful, boy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Musta been some bad ass nuclear tests here in the 50's. This town's all inbreeding.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Well, people gotta get by somehow. That's the curse. The mines done it. All that uranium, plutonium, fuffonium, fuckononium, assononium, all that "om"! Everybody's got a mother. You don't rip up your mother. You don't rip up the Earth and take everything out. It's like the Cracker Jack box says, "the more you eat, the more you want...."...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I got things to do.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: ...But ain't you got a little something for the infirm?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm a little short Pops. I'll catch you next time.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Your lies are old, but you tell 'em well.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Ain't over yet.  Night is part of day; separate, but equal.  Night is when you let your guard down; when you see things in the shadows and hear things in the dark.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Difference between you and me, old man, is I see the glass half full, you see it half empty.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Night is when you want to sleep, but the dry heat keeps you tossin' and turnin'. It's when you wish the sun was bakin' high in the sky so you could see what it is you're afraid of.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You afraid of the dark?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Afraid of it?  Boy, I live in the dark. All cause of a woman who made me this way. People are afraid of what they can't see. I can't see nuthin', so it's all the same to me.  Kiss from a beautiful woman, kissy kissy kiss, a lick from a dog, slurp, slurp, the kiss of death . It's all the same to me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: So, we're all just floating along like twigs in a stream, so enjoy the ride.  Is that it?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: More or less.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Not this twig, friend.  I got plans.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Nothing makes the Great Spirit laugh harder than a man's plans. We all got plans. I planned on seeing all my life. I know you didn't plan on straying into town.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No and I don't plan on sticking around either.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Well, don't say I didn't warn you when things go your way.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You got a lotta philosophy in you, old timer but you don't fool me for one second with all this blind man crap. One minute you lost your eyes in Vietnam, next it's the joint. Now it's a woman? I'm hep to you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Time's up. Any last words of wisdom?

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: Things ain't always the way they seem. You got to ask yourself: is it worth it? Day comes Earthmaker is going to look in your fucking heart! Then you better know what it is you're doing. <u>Are you a human being</u> -- or just one of them hungry ghosts out there floatin' around?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You <u>are</u> crazy, you know. Be seeing you, old man.

turns.speaker: BLIND MAN
turns.text: You know I won't be seeing you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I wasn't doing anything.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: That's not the way it looked to me.  Looked to me like you was trying to make time with her.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Make time?  Is everybody in this town on drugs?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Then maybe you should've. Look, pal, I wasn't making a play for your girl.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: You expect me to believe that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't care what you believe as long as you leave me alone.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Mister, I'm calling you out.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?  You want to fight?  Over her?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Let's see...they're not very imaginative?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: 'Cause I'm just like dynamite.  And when I go off, somebody gets hurt.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Fine.  I was making time with your girl. Now I'm scared to death and I learned my lesson. Now can you go away?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Not before I settle with you, chickenshit!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Christ, I don't believe this!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Stand up.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I wasn't hitting on your girl!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Stand up, Mister, or I'll beat you where you sit.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Mister!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh, shit!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: That's right, Mister.  You better be afraid.  I told you it wasn't over, but you didn't listen.  Now I find you sneakin' around with my girl behind my back.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I wasn't sneaking around with your girl. Would you please tell him?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Oh, that tears it, Mister.  I'm gonna bust you up but good.  I'm gonna bust you into a million pieces and then ... and then bust those pieces up, and then ... and then spread them all around.  That's what I'm gonna do.  You don't know what you're dealing with, Mister.  I'm crazy.  I'm psycho crazy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, I know.  You're TNT.  Just like dynamite.  When you go off somebody gets hurt.  All right.  Let's do this.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I'm doing what any man would do if he'd been offended.  I'm stompin' your ass.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You idiot!  You don't even know what you're fighting over!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: My honor, that's what I'm fighting over. Now get up off the ground, or do I have to whoop you where you lie?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Now, what's this?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Give it to me!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Mexico?  You going to Mexico?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm leaving.  You never have to see me again.  Just please, give me the ticket!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: This means something to you?  Jenny means something to me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who the hell is this!?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm her husband.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Now who the hell are you, and it better be good, or God help me I'll break you in half.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Easy, chief. I... I was helping your wife. I met her in town.  She needed a hand with her drapes.  That's all.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Didn't much look like you were hanging drapes.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I swear to you that's all that happened.  I haven't so much as set foot in your bedroom.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: A lot that means.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Grace, tell him.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You can't just walk in here and walk out, you sonufabitch! I'm gonna tear you a new asshole!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You broke my nose!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It ain't broke.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the fuck do you want?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'll give you a lift, son. Too hot to be walking... People die out here, y'know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: After you huffed off, Grace lied so bad, I got so pissed off, I pulled down her pants to paddle her ass raw and finger-fucked it instead. Sorry I lost my cool like that. It's a funny thing, women.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Say, what happened to your hand?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Accident.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You've got to be--

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, I know.  More careful.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I guess we've never been introduced proper. Jake McKenna.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's a solid name.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm a solid man.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bobby Cooper.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: "Bobby Cooper." What brings you to Superior, Coop?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: An overheated car.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Oh? Darrell taking good care of you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Darrell's a moron.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: California...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Live there?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Got work.  I know a man who's got a boat. Wants me to sail it for him.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You a sailor man?  That'd be the life. Drive across the country, step on a boat and just sail away.  A man could pretty well disappear like that.  Just sail away until all he was was a memory.  I guess a little place like this would just be a dot on a map to you after awhile.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I hope so.  Listen, McKenna about your wife:  If I had known she was married--

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It wouldn't have made a difference to you, now would it?  Not a wit.  Do you know why? Because you're a man without scruples.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Wait a second--

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ah, I can smell it on you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's the sweat of a man who hasn't an honest bone in his body.  Don't be offended, lad.  A man who's got no ethics is a free man.  I envy that.  Beside, how can I blame you?  That Grace sure has a mind of her own, and a body to match, don't she?  Eh?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: She does at that.  I knew when I married her she was a free spirit.  A woman with her looks and a man my age; what was I to expect?  But you see a woman like that in a town like this and you don't think, you do. So, I married her.  What are you to do, eh? Women.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Can't live with them, and you can't shoot 'em.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: "You can't shoot 'em!" I like that.  I bet she led you on good, didn't she?  Taking you up to the house to hang drapes. Oh that's a good one. Bet she had you hard as a rock wiggling her ass in your face.  I bet you just wanted to pull down her pants and hog her out. Then me busting in like some wild bear. Ha! Bet you had a fire going under you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Like you don't know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Mad like a dog in heat, I bet you were.  I can tell you got a temper on you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Would you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Would I what?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Would you kill her?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I've done a few things but I'm not a murderer, Mr. McKenna.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How do you know if you've never tried?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: This is a joke, right?  You just want to rattle me.  Right?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What can I do for you, lad?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I was hoping we could talk.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Talk?  About what?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: About things.  About your wife.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Sweet Grace?  What about her?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: About what you said this morning.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You said you had an insurance policy out on your wife.  Fifty-thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You said you'd cut that up with the man who did her in.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't play simple with me, Jake. You're a betting man. You want me to spell it out for you? I'll kill Grace if you cut me in on the money.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Boy I think this heat's getting to you the way you're rambling on.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm not rambling.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're talking like a madman.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well then, I guess that qualifies me for citizenship in this town. You're the one brought it up. This morning. In your car.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Oh, that was just loose talk. Husband gettin' pissed off.  I don't want anybody dead.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bullshit.  You wanted me to kill her.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: A man doesn't always mean the things he says.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You meant it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What makes you say that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Because you're a slimy bastard who would have his wife killed just to get his hands on some money.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And what does that make you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: The slimy bastard who's going to do it for you...  You're a jealous man Jake. If you can't have Grace to yourself...well, you're not the sharing kind.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, I guess I have what you call a love-hate relationship with Grace.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You love her, but you hate her?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, I hate loving her. I hate the kind of person she is. I hate having to tolerate the little "games" she plays. Like fucking half of the town behind my back and laughing at me. The bitch. She loved to play. She wants me to hit her and when I hit her she likes it. She tortures me. But she's family. She's my little girl. My baby. I couldn't stand to watch her eyes roll back in her head as she sucks her last breath, or to see her pretty pink brains spill from her skull. No. Not me. But you? You got the killing in you, boy...How much you want?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How much could you get?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Maybe ... ten-thousand.  And that's a maybe.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I need thirteen.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's a bit much.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We're not talking about buying a car Jake. We're talking about killing your wife. It's thirteen, or it's nothing.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You drive a hard bargain, but I had a feeling you were my boy when I met you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm not your boy.  I don't like you.  I got no choice but to do business with you. Let's just call this a nasty little marriage of convenience.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't say that.  I had a marriage of convenience with Grace, and look where that's lead...  Well, looks like we got ourselves a contract.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: If you can't trust the man you've hired to kill your wife ...? The thing is it's got to look like an accident; that's the thing. If it doesn't, then it's no good.  I won't get a dime, and it's my neck that'll be on the chopping block while you're living it up somewhere.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How do you want it?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How the hell should I know?  I've never had a wife killed before. Jesus Christ! <u>You</u> want this job, you don't know how to do this? I guess I should have hired a professional.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You want to do this yourself?  I don't have to do this, you know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Be quiet, boy.  I got to figure this thing. I'm thinking. It can't be done at the house. It should be...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Come to think of it, how 'bout some money upfront?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Oh yeah sure. Why don't I buy you a plane ticket right out of here while I'm at it. I <u>know you</u>...  This is what you do:  Go to the house to see her.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: And tell her what?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: ...I don't know.  Tell her you had to see her.  Tell her you don't care if she's married or not, you had to be with her. Sweet talk the woman.  A young buck like you must be good at that.  Then ... maybe shift the conversation.  Get her thinking about that jeep of hers.  She loves that thing.  Maybe the only thing she does love. She'll want to take you for a ride.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I know you're not surprised I'm back here, cause you can read my mind and all.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Next time you'll do just fine.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's my gun... That fucking Darrell!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I like Darrell.  He may be an idiot, but he's my half brother. We own Harlin's together, yeah, that little redneck manages to get paid no matter how things work out.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I guess this is what they call "ironee"? Hunh?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's not what you think, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, but it don't matter anyway when you're lying there with your brains all over my carpet and I'm telling Sheriff Potter about this drifter, didn't have enough money to fix his car. And Darrell happened to find his gun, and through maybe this drifter heard old Jake got some money stashed away, and figgered he might try to break in and steal it!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Just listen to me...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: ...And he thought he'd clock old Jake McKenna and turn his brains into wall paper...and then maybe borrow $200 or $20,000, or $200,000...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I came for Grace.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You came to take my wife from me?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Shhh! Liar.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's the truth, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's a thick change of heart from this afternoon.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Maybe I don't like being played, like she played us today.  Maybe I don't like that at all, Jake. I'm just pissed enough, maybe I'll rip the neck off my own grandmother.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You have a lot of talk in you, whole lot of talk.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Damn it, Jake. There is a guy coming to kill me, and if it comes down to me or Grace, then I pick Grace.  You were going to give me thirteen-thousand.  Give me two-hundred.  I'll kill her and dump the body where no one will ever find it. She showed me the perfect place. There won't be enough left for an autopsy.  But I need the the money.  I've got to have the money.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How the hell did you know where the bedroom's at?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What are you talking about!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Come on, Jake --

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't Jake me boy! It's a big house. You probably didn't even make it out to the desert this afternoon...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You'd tell me anything to save your pathetic life.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You know what kind of woman Grace is, Jake. You know how badly she wants to get the fuck out of Superior.  What's she to you, Jake; a woman who wants you dead?  Let me kill her.  All I want is two-hundred dollars to get out of here with.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Two-hundred dollars?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Two-hundred dollars...I'll do it!  I'll kill her!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Hey, Mister.  You gotta quarter for the juke?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I wanna play a song on the juke.  You got a quarter?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What happened to your hand?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I cut it shaving; I know, I gotta be more careful.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Got any requests?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That country shit all sounds the same to me.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: How about I pick one out for you?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You like Patsy Cline?  I just love her. How come, I wonder, she don't put out no more new records.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Cause she's dead.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Gee, that's sad.  Don't that make you sad?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I've had time to get over it.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You're not from around here, are you? Where you from?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oz.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You ain't from Oz.  Oz is in that movie.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You're too quick for me.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Hey mister. Mister, I just... I just wanted to thank you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: For defending my honor this afternoon.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I hate to bust your bubble honey, but I wasn't defending you.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: But you was going to fight for me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I wasn't going to fight for you.  I was just going to beat the shit out of your boyfriend.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: He's not my boyfriend.  I mean, I let him take me out and stuff, but I ain't spoken for.  Not yet that is.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Get it through your head, little girl; I'm not going for you.  If this Toby likes you, then if I were you I'd marry him.  You're not going to get much better in this town.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: That's what I thought until you came riding in.  I saw your car over at the gas station.  It's a cool car.  Want to take me for a ride?  Desert's kind of lonely this time of day.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How old are you?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Eighteen... Well, I'm gonna be eighteen in two years, but that don't mean you can't take me for a ride if you want.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, I don't want to take you for a ride. What I want is for ... Hey, you don't think you can get $150 from your parents, could you?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You're too late, Toby.  We're going to get in his fancy car and ride off and leave you behind.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What's your name anyway?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Toby Tucker, it don't matter to me if you beat him all up and knock out all his teeth and he's just drooling and bleeding all over hisself, 'cause we love each other and we gonna run off, and I'm gonna have his love child.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Will you shut up!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Don't be afraid of him none.  I don't care what he does to you, we can still be together.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Get away from me!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You Harlin?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Nope.  Darrell.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Harlin around?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: He's up at the Look Out.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Will he be back soon?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Doubt it.  He's dead.  The Look Out's a cemetery.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You own this place?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Then why do you call it Harlin's?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: 'Cause Harlin used to own it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: But he's dead.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You want to take a look at my car?  I think the radiator hose is--

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Damn.  Gonna be another hot one today. Sometimes I don't even want to get out of bed. Course don't want to get out for the cold one's neither.  Then of course the clouds come in...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Look, Harlin, I've got places to be.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Darrell--

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: OK. Darrell... Could you just take a look at my radiator hose.  It's busted.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: It's your radiator hose.  It's busted.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I know it's busted.  What did I just tell you?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Well, you know so much why don't you just fix it yourself?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: If I could do you think I'd be standing here wasting my time.  Can you fix it, or do I have to go somewhere else?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Somewhere else?  Mister, somewhere else is fifty miles from here. Only other gas station down in town closed 3 years ago when the mine got shut...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Okay, I'm stuck.  You happy?  Now can you fix it, or not?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Yeah, I can fix it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Great!

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Gotta run over to the yard and see if I can find a hose like this one, or close enough. Gonna take time.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How much time?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Time.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Twenty-after-ten.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Jesus.  Twenty-after-ten and it must be ninety already.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Ninety-two.  Course half hour from now might be seventy-two. These clouds move around a lot.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Accident.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: You got to be more careful. Hands is important.  Let me show you something. When I was a kid, now I don't know if you can still see it, but I gashed my fingers in a lawnmower.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm very interested in this but is there someplace...

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Diner up a piece.  Not much, but us simple folk like it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'll be back in a couple of hours.  And be careful with her, will you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Hey, your ... what the hell happened to you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Don't look like nothing.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Just banged my head.  It was an accident.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Another accident?  You got to be more careful.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the hell happened to my car?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Bottom hose was shot too.  Rotted clear through. Had to put a new one in. Runs like a dream now.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Well ... you got your parts, you got your labour ... let's call it a hundred-fifty bucks.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How much!?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Hundred-fifty.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: To replace a goddamn radiator hose!?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: A goddamn radiator hose in a sixty-four-and-a-half Mustang.  You know how long it took me to find that hose?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: About an hour and a half, because that's all the longer I've been gone.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Actually, it's been about three hours. You're the one thinks that car's so damn fancy.  What you expect but fancy damn prices?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's a Ford, not a Ferrari.  You going to tell me no one else in this shit hole drives a Ford?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: "That's not just a Ford, that's a sixty-four-and-a-half Mustang."

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's that got to do with the radiator hose?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: I don't know, but "it's the reason I'm living here and you're just passing through."  Now you owe me a hundred-fifty dollars.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It might as well be fifteen-hundred dollars, because I don't have the money.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Then you ain't gonna have the car.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Listen, man.  I got rolled half an hour ago for everything I had.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Then you're only a hundred-forty-five in the hole.  You can keep that dollar. Now why don't you just take your American Express Gold Card, and call that guy with the big schnooz on TV and have him send you the money lickity split.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't have a goddamn credit card.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Now that's too bad.  I sure hope you know how to wash dishes or shovel shit 'cause you're gonna have to work this one off.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: ...got no day, got no date.  Probably ain't worth a duck's fart . This one here cost me $3.75 and it's got every doodad you can imagine. No sir I'll stick with this .

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You son of a bitch! I'll have my lawyers shut you down.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: You ain't got no credit card but you got a lawyer. Sweet talk me all you want.  Didn't you read the sign? It says...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What sign? Fuck the sign. I want my car.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: I want my hundred and forty-five dollars.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Hey there.  I was beginnin' to think you wasn't comin' back...  You don't look so good.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, well, I've been around the bend a bit.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: One of those days you feel like you been runnin' in circles and you ain't no closer to where you tryin' to get than when you started?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You've been there?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Hell, I've had days I would gladly trade with a whippin' dog.  Ain't much you can do when you feel like that 'cept tough it out.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You believe that?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: You think bad, and bad is what you get.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's a good piece of advice, Darrell.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: No charge.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Listen, Darrell, about that hundred-fifty bucks for the car, as soon as I get where I'm going I swear I'll--

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Two-hundred.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: It's going to cost you two-hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You said this morning the hose was going to run me one-fifty.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Yep.  For the hose.  But while you was gone I replaced a gasket.  That's going to run you another fifty.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I didn't tell you to replace any gasket.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Yeah, but it was shot.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't give a fuck! I didn't tell you to do it!  You can't just do unauthorized work.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Well, now, you just know all there is about bein' a mechanic, don't you?  Didn't you read the sign.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What sign?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: The goddamn sign on the wall. I can't do unauthorized work?  What am I suppose to do? Just let you ride out of here with a bad gasket.  Then you get in an accident and get killed.  Or worse.  Who they gonna blame then?  They gonna blame me, and there goes my reputation.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What reputation?  You're nothing but an ignorant, inbred, tumbleweed hick.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Is that an insult?  Are you insulting me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Listen you stupid fuck, I want my car.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Listen to me you sorry sonufabitch. You owe me money, and this car ain't going nowheres until I get it.  And if you take another five hours I'll find another fifty dollars worth of work to do on it. Is that clear? Now get out of here 'fore I call the Sheriff, <u>who knows me</u>.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No! Okay! Okay!

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: What's the matter?  The fight gone out of you?  I'm just gonna smash a headlight. Maybe two.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Look, Harlin.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Darrell.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Darrell. I'll get you your money. I just have to get something out of the trunk.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the fuck did you do to my trunk?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Well, that key's not gonna work. I had to pop the lock. You didn't leave me the trunk key.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: And you had to go into the trunk, didn't you?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: When I work on a car, I work on a car.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: What you want?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Open up!

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: We're closed.  Come back when the sun comes up.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: What the hell ... oh, it's you.  Might've figgered. Listen I got a waitress coming over.  What do you want?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I want my car.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: You got the money?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: Two-hundred dollars in hundred-dollar bills.  And this morning you was broke.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's none of your business.  Get the keys.

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: I don't want no dirty money.  I run an honest business.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, like Al Capone on tax day. Get the keys?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: All I got's a hundred, Darrell. You got change?

turns.speaker: DARRELL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Figgers. There's a scratch on the hood and how much you make selling my gun? Deduct it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Got any cold soda?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Eh?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Soda.  You got any soda?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Hablar slowly, por favor.  My ingles no es bien.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Soda.  You know.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I call the sheriff.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No! No police.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Can I give you a hand, beautiful?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'm just going to my car?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's right on my way.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: My mother told me never to accept offers from strangers.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: My name is Bobby.  Now I'm not a stranger anymore.  See how easy it is for us to get to know each other, beautiful?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Do you have to call me that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't know your real name.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Maybe I don't want you to.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Maybe, but if you didn't I think you would have kept on walking.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You're pretty full of yourself, aren't you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I like that about me, beautiful.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's Grace.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: May I carry your package, Grace?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You sure you can manage?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I got it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Do you want me to carry your pack for you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, I've got it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What happened to your hand?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Accident.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You should be more careful.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's very nice of you to help me.  That package is kind of heavy, and it's so hot.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No trouble at all, really.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Wasn't nothing.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Oh, this isn't my car.  It's down a ways. I should have parked closer.  I just didn't think it would be so heavy.  I could drive up.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's all right.  I got it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Thank you, Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You're welcome, Grace.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You're not from around here, are you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why you say that?  Just because I help a lady with her package?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You don't have that dead look in your eyes like the only thing you live for is to get through the day.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I just drove in this morning.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Drove into Superior?  What for?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Didn't have a choice.  My car overheated up the road.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You're lucky you didn't break down in the desert.  Day like today, you'd be dead in no time. When you leaving?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Not until my car's fixed.  I don't know how long that's going to take.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: And here I've made you all hot and sweaty.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Where you coming from?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: All over.  Chicago, Houston, Detroit.  Just lately Dallas.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You've been around.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I guess I've got wander in my blood.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Where you headed?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't know.  I have to make a stop in Vegas.  Business to finish.  Then maybe I'll head to Santa Barbara.  I might be able to pick up some action there.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: So, what is it you do, Mister...?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Cooper. Bobby Cooper. Oh you know, whatever pays best. Little bartending, used to teach tennis, played a little competition ... .

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I never played tennis. You just travel around Bobby-- no direction, no steady work.  You must like taking chances.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: If you're going to gamble, might as well play for high stakes.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What happens when you lose?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I pack up and go somewhere else.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's good.  Cools you right off.  I saw you watching me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I didn't say it bothered me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Did you like it; me watching you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I guess.  I've got an ego same as any man.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Good, 'cause I liked what I saw.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nice place.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Must get kind of lonely for a woman living by herself in a big house.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I guess it must.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What do you do anyway?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: A little of this, a little of that.  Mostly I tell fortunes.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where'd you learn to do that?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: From my father.  He was the tribe's shaman.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: A medicine man?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Those are white words, not ours.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nice house for a shaman's daughter.  You must be good.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Come here.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: My face tell you all that?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It tells me what every face tells me. Everybody has a past, they have a pain, and they have something they want.  What is it you want?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: The same thing you do.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: There.  All done.  Lift me down.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Lift me down.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You can let go of me now. I'm safe. How do they look?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Like you.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Beautiful?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I like them.  I was sick of looking at this room.  I think they add a little life.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nothing like a little liveliness.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No more drapes to hang.  Now what should we do?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I have an idea.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: And what would that be?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You flirt with me, then you run cold.  You lead me on, then slap me down.  I don't go for being jerked around.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Really?  And what game did you want to play?  You carry my box for me, and I fall into bed with you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I think I can find my own way back to into town.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Maybe I like to find out about a man first. Maybe I like to know what he's made of.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm just flesh and blood, baby.  That and a few memories of bad women; just like most guys.  But you already know that.  You read my mind, remember? Thanks for the lemonade.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You never did answer my question.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Still playing?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: That's not an answer.  What is it you want?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You know what I want.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Maybe I just want to hear you say it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, well I said I was an idiot. Whatta you say we get out of here, take a drive somewhere, talk...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: How do you know he's still not here?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Guys like me take those chances. Let's go.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Are there snakes out here?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: They hear you comin'.  They won't bother you. Just don't sneak up on 'em.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Doesn't the isolation bother you?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Yeah, but I like the sun.  I grew up on a reservation.  The sun, the desert; they like a religion to us.  Jake's the same way.  He loves the desert.  I guess we're alike that way.  That's about the only way.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You love him?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Did you ever?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Depends on what you call love. I grew up on a reservation. A patch of desert in the middle of nowhere. That's where they stick Indians, Bobby. That's where they leave us to die. My brother killed himself when he was 19 cause he couldn't take it anymore. There's no hope there... Jake was my ticket out. Mom and me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Is that why you're with him?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I let him think he was courtin' me, but I reeled him in like a fish on a line. I wanted him. I wanted what he could give me, and I would've done anything to get him. Is that love?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm guessing no.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Yeah, I guess you're right.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I take it things didn't much work out the way you planned.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'm still here, aren't I?  See this?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: All this nothing? It doesn't get to Jake like it gets to me.  He says he don't mind being nothing but a big fish in a small pond.  More like a little fish in a dried up watering hole.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You could leave him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't know how.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Walk away.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's not that easy.  Maybe you can take chances; maybe you can wander around like some stray wherever you please.  I can't. I don't want to be alone.  I need to know I'm going to be taken care of.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You need a meal ticket is what you mean. Some guy you can latch onto just long enough for him to get you out of here.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Is that so bad?  It's not like I wouldn't try to make him happy.  For awhile, anyway. I mean, I would ... do things for him.  I guess I'm no good that way.  I guess I tried to sucker you along like that.  Do you hate me for it?  I wouldn't blame you if you did.  But maybe it's like you said: You just got to do whatever it takes to get out.
